September 30, 1957
Dr. Harry J. Skornia, Executive Director
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
3ii Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harry}
I have just received copies of those letters from the University
of Houston and The Albuquerque Public Schools with reference to
their nominees for the Research Seminar.
I don’t like to set administrative policies that can’t be changed
when needed, however, this material is so late that if we make an
exception on this, we would have to do it on all the other late
applications. The final list has been made up and will be in the
hands of the committee members on Tuesday morning) it would delay
the returns, even if I could hold them up at this late date, if
another and revised list was sent out.
In view of the fact that I feel it essential to get the master list
to you and Tyler, since it will take considerable time to contact
the selected nominees and to firra-up those acceptances, I will sticl
by the September 25, Tallahassee, deadline, unless some truly ex¬
ceptional conditions arise.
Sincerely,
Raymond D. Cheydleur, Chairman
NAEB Research Committee
RDCsas
c.c. I Keith Tyler
